ALBURY CITY.notes: Albury City successfully completed transition away from SGARs in December 2024 to a non-anticoagulant product.

ARMIDALE REGIONAL.notes: We are seeking confirmation for 2025; confirmed no participation in baiting programs in 2024.

BALLINA.notes: We are seeking clarification on specific rodenticides used at managed buildings.

BALRANALD.notes: Balranald used commercial wax blocks (active ingredient unknown) at 3 facilities in October 2024; this program has concluded. We are seeking confirmation on rodenticides used.

BATHURST REGIONAL.notes: Correspondence with Bathurst states they are 'not aware of any change' from 2024 practices, including the use of SGARs (Storm/flocoumafen and Ditrac/brodifacoum).

BAYSIDE.notes: Correspondence with Bayside states 'there will be rodent blitz programs [...] around areas identified with high level of rodent activities' and that these 'blitz programs' are mainly conducted during the warmer months when outdoor activities and BBQ use increases.

BEGA VALLEY.notes: Bega Valley uses Ditrac (brodifacoum) as the contractor's preferred product. The program at John Gordon Reserve ended due to building upgrade.

BELLINGEN.notes: Council does not undertake baiting or trapping; LLS handles most wildlife management.

BERRIGAN.notes: We are seeking confirmation for 2025 activities.

BLACKTOWN.notes: Council's Natural Areas Team does not engage in baiting. We are seeking confirmation from other departments (Facilities, Environmental Services, Contract Managers, Parks).

BLAND.notes: Rodenticides may have been used small scale in the past.

BLAYNEY.notes: Blayney engages in shooting and sporadic use of Pindone for rabbits.

BLUE MOUNTAINS.notes: Blue Mountains uses integrated pest management and only FGARs are used where necessary to minimise harm to wildlife. Council also engages in fox trapping and euthanasia.

BOGAN.notes: Bogan engages Termitrust for annual spraying and maintaining bait stations around buildings (Termite baits: Requiem and Trelona).

BOURKE.notes: Bourke's pest control contractor places rodenticides containing flocoumafen (an SGAR) inside buildings where rodents reported.

BROKEN HILL.notes: No rodent control in facilities. Council manages foxes, cats, and goats in the Living Desert and culls wildlife hazards at airport using lethal/pyrotechnic rounds.

BYRON.notes: Byron successfully implemented an SGAR-free policy in July 2022 for community halls.

CABONNE.notes: We are seeking confirmation for 2025 on rodenticide use and planned programs (including pigeon/rabbit control).

CAMDEN.notes: A motion prohibiting use of SGARs on council land carried in August 2022. It effectively prohibits all baiting, including SGARs, on council land.

CAMPBELLTOWN.notes: Motion prohibiting use of SGARs on council land carried in August 2022. This motion effectively prohibits all baiting, including SGARs, on council land. Rodent control is treated on a case-by-case basis.

CANADA BAY.notes: SGARs not used in open space. If used in buildings, SGARs are placed in lockable, tamper-resistant boxes. The specific SGARs used have not been confirmed.

CANTERBURY-BANKSTOWN.notes: Council states all animal control activities are undertaken in accordance with Government guidelines. Council has requested a formal GIPA application for details.

CENTRAL COAST.notes: Council uses 'Fastrac Blox', containing brodifacoum (SGAR) in bait stations. Council also has planned 1080 baiting campaigns for foxes and dingoes.

CESSNOCK.notes: Rodent baits are used in/around buildings through pest control contractor, specific product used not provided.

CLARENCE VALLEY.notes: Council resolved to only use FGARs 1-2 years ago.

COFFS HARBOUR.notes: Council's Holiday Parks contractor uses 'Talon XT Pro', containing brodifacoum (SGAR). Racumin, which contains coumatetralyl, is used in buildings when required.

COOLAMON.notes: Council engages a certified contractor like Flick. Correspondence with Council was unable to provide specific rodenticides used by contractors.

COOTAMUNDRA-GUNDAGAI REGIONAL.notes: Council uses traditional domestic rodenticides in facilities when required - we have been unable to confirm the specific rodenticides applied. LLS was previously used on a larger scale.

COWRA.notes: Council engages in termite and ant control in and around buildings.

DUBBO REGIONAL.notes: Council uses 'Contrac', containing bromadiolone (SGAR), in council buildings. These buildings include administration, theatres, depots, airports, libraries, visitor centres, aquatic, and waste facilities.

DUNGOG.notes: Rodent baits are used in/around buildings through local pest control contractor, specific product used has not been provided.

EDWARD RIVER.notes: Council has confirmed no use of rodenticides or planned pest control programs.

EUROBODALLA.notes: SGARs are used inside buildings and Council considers this 'low risk'. Council's Invasive Species Team also uses Pindone for rabbit control.

FEDERATION.notes: Council's pest control contractor uses 'Ditrac', containing brodifacoum (SGAR), for rodent control.

FORBES.notes: Council has confirmed that bromadiolone (SGAR) is used in bait stations.

GEORGES RIVER.notes: Council uses 'Contrac Blox', containing bromadiolone (SGAR), around its facilities.

GOULBURN MULWAREE.notes: Council uses 'Ditrac', containing brodifacoum (SGAR), in sensitive buildings, including art galleries and museums).

GREATER HUME SHIRE.notes: Council uses a 'standard rodenticide' - information about the specific product applied has not been provided.

GRIFFITH.notes: Council confimed in 2024 that it does not use chemical pesticides for lethal control of wildlife. We are seeking confirmation that this remains accurate for 2025.

GUNNEDAH.notes: Council's contractor uses enclosed bait stations and a smart system to reduce reliance. The specific rodenticides applied has not been confirmed.

GWYDIR.notes: Council uses rodenticides in bait stations at some facilities. The specific product used has not been confirmed.

HAWKESBURY.notes: Council uses 'Ditrac', containing brodifacoum (SGAR) in bait stations around facilities. Council has engaged in rabbit control using 1080 in the past.

HAY.notes: Council stated that 'We have no comment to make'.

HILLTOPS.notes: Council has confirmed no use of rodenticides or planned programs.

HORNSBY.notes: Council's policy states that SGARs are never used. The rabbit cage trap lending program will continue in 2025 and Council may participate in RHDV release and use contract shooters for fox/rabbit control if grants are secured.

HUNTERS HILL.notes: Council's contractor (Rentokil) uses 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), 'Contrac' (bromadiolone), and 'Maki Block' (bromadiolone) baits, all containing SGARs.

INNER WEST.notes: Council's Urban Ecology Manager has confirmed that no baiting or other control programs will be undertaken in 2025.

INVERELL.notes: SGARs may be used in facilities, but specific products are currently unknown.

JUNEE.notes: Council confirmed no rodenticide use in building management.

KEMPSEY.notes: Council maintains that wildlife management is LLS responsibility.

KIAMA.notes: Council uses 'Selontra', containing colecalciferol, around buildings, and conducts reactive rabbit/fox control.

KU-RING-GAI.notes: Council requested a formal GIPA application to access information.

KYOGLE.notes: Council's contractor, Flick uses SGARS at sewer/pump stations.

LACHLAN.notes: Council's contractor uses Tomcat All Weather Blox, containing bromadiolone (SGAR).

LAKE MACQUARIE.notes: Council successfully phased out 'Ditrac' from its internal store and is reviewing tenders to implement wildlife-friendly options for contractors.

LANE COVE.notes: Council uses coumatetralyl (FGAR) and brodifacoum (SGAR) for rodent control.

LEETON.notes: Council confirmed in 2024 that it does not conduct baiting or stock chemical pesticides. We are seeking confirmation for 2025.

LISMORE.notes: Council's contractor, Flick, uses 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), 'Contrac' (bromadiolone), and 'Generation First Strike' (difethialone).

LIVERPOOL.notes: Council has confirmed use of brodifacoum (SGAR) in council buildings.

LIVERPOOL PLAINS.notes: Rodenticides are used in facilities managed by property management section. Information on the specific rodenticides applied has not been provided.

MID-WESTERN REGIONAL.notes: Council does not use rodenticides. There was a 'one-off' fox shooting program conducted in 2024.

MOREE PLAINS.notes: We are seeking confirmation from Council's Building Maintenance team regarding rodenticide use in facilities and other control programs.

MOSMAN.notes: Council's contractor, Flick, uses brodifacoum. Council has acknowledged the potential secondary poisoning risk of using SGARs.

MUSWELLBROOK.notes: Council's contractor uses enclosed bait stations and a smart system to reduce reliance. The specific rodenticides used has not been confirmed.

NAMBUCCA VALLEY.notes: Council's contractor, Rentokil, uses 'Maki Block' (bromadiolone) and 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), both containing SGARs.

NARRANDERA.notes: Council confirmed in 2024 that it does not undertake baiting or wildlife control programs. We are seeking confirmation for 2025.

NARROMINE.notes: Council uses 'Talon XT Pro' (brodifacoum), 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), and 'Contrac' (bromadiolone), all containing SGARs.

NORTH SYDNEY.notes: Council's contractor uses coumatetralyl, cholecalciferol, bromadiolone, brodifacoum, difethialone, and FGARs. SGARs (bromadiolone, brodifacoum, difethialone) are used for short durations in commercial centres when needed.

NORTHERN BEACHES.notes: Council has a policy of not using SGARs in operations, which includes SGAR-free conditions in facility lease renewals.

OBERON.notes: Council has confirmed no use of rodenticides or planned programs.

PARKES.notes: No rodenticides have been used recently due to lack of 'plague proportion' activity.

CITY OF PARRAMATTA.notes: Council uses rodenticides in 3 buildings. The specific rodenticides and locations are considered 'commercial in confidence'. Council has continued its policy not to engage in 1080 poison baiting for foxes at Lake Parramatta Reserve in 2025.

PORT MACQUARIE-HASTINGS.notes: Council has been SGAR free since January 2022.

PORT STEPHENS.notes: Council uses 'SureFire Couma blocks', containing coumatetralyl (FGAR), in enclosed bait stations.

QUEANBEYAN-PALERANG REGIONAL.notes: Council has confirmed no use of rodenticides.

RANDWICK.notes: Council has confirmed it uses SGARs.

RICHMOND VALLEY.notes: Council has confirmed that pest control contractors are used on an as need basis. We have been unable to confirm the specific rodenticides used.

RYDE.notes: Council uses racumin (FGAR), selontra (colecalciferol), 'Muskil Dual Active Rodenticide' (bromadiolone + difenacoum - SGARs).

SHELLHARBOUR.notes: Council has confirmed no rodenticide use around facilities.

SNOWY MONARO REGIONAL.notes: Council has confirmed it uses registered rodenticides as required for staff/asset protection. We have been unable to confirm the specific rodenticides used.

SNOWY VALLEYS.notes: Council confirmed no baiting operations in 2024. We are seeking confirmation for 2025.

SYDNEY.notes: Council's contractor, Ventia, uses 'Contrac' (bromadiolone), 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), 'Talon XT Pro' (brodifacoum), and 'Selontra' (colecalciferol) for rodent control in premises/facilities.

TEMORA.notes: Council has confirmed no use of rodenticides.

TENTERFIELD.notes: Council has confirmed no baiting operations or programmed rodent control.

THE HILLS SHIRE.notes: Council uses 'Generation First Strike' (difethialone), 'Maki Blocks/Bromard Paste' (bromadiolone), 'Ditrac Blox' (brodifacoum), and 'Selontra' (colecalciferol). Though Council stated that they do not use SGARs, several SGARs are listed in their product list.

TWEED.notes: Council discontinued use of SGARs in 2023.

UPPER HUNTER.notes: Council uses 'Racumin', containing coumatetralyl (FGAR), in bait stations.

URALLA.notes: Council confimed no control programs in 2024. We are seeking confirmation for 2025.

WAGGA WAGGA.notes: Council uses 'Muskil Dual Active', containing difenacoum and bromadiolone (SGARs).

WALGETT.notes: Council uses rodenticides in premises, but the specific products and locations have not been confirmed.

WARREN.notes: Council Uses traps primarily for rodents and used 'Mouse Off', containing zinc phosphide, during the 'mouse plague'.

WARRUMBUNGLE.notes: Council has confirmed it does not engage in baiting programs.

WAVERLEY.notes: Council's conntractor uses 'Generation First Strike' (difethialone) or 'Ditrac' (brodifacoum), both containing SGARs.

WEDDIN.notes: Council confirmed it is currently not using rodenticides and does not have any planned programs.

WENTWORTH.notes: Council confirmed no operations using SGARs or other planned wildlife control programs.

WILLOUGHBY.notes: Council has confirmed no SGAR use by its contractor.

WINGECARRIBEE.notes: Council has confirmed it will use 'Ditrac Blox' (brodifacoum) and 'Big Cheese' (bromadiolone), both SGARs.

WOLLONDILLY.notes: Council implemented tender requirements restricting SGAR use, mandating FGARs unless explicitly approved.

WOLLONGONG.notes: We are seeking confirmation for 2025 on rodenticide use and planned changes for priority species control.

WOOLLAHRA.notes: Council has confirmed it uses electronic traps instead of rodenticides.
